title: From Oil Rigs to Green Energy: MacGregor’s Vision
content: On Tuesday, May 6th, the Sciences Po American Foundation held its 2025 Annual Benefit Dinner, honoring Catherine MacGregor, CEO of ENGIE, with the Stanley Hoffmann Award. Her 30-year career in the energy sector demonstrates exceptional contributions to one of the greatest challenges of our time: the global energy transition. MacGregor was interviewed by Andrew Edgecliffe-Johnson, CEO Editor of Semafor. During their conversation, she reflected on her commitment to forward-looking leadership, echo...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Pia Sarah Haykel awarded the 2025 Michel David-Weill Scholarship
content: Pia Sarah Haykel will receive her Bachelor of Arts degree in History from Princeton University in May 2025, pursuing a certificate in European Cultural Studies and a minor in Persian. Pia’s research work has taken her across Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the United States. Her thesis examines material and visual cultures, specifically the trade of textiles, diamonds, and spices between Europeans, Safavids, and Mughals. On campus at Princeton, Pia is a student researcher for the Special Coll...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Incert supports the launch of “Technology and Global Affairs Innovation Hub”
content: The Paris School of International Affairs (PSIA) Technology and Global Affairs Innovation Hub’s core mission is to accelerate collaborative technology and governance to address global affairs challenges. The Hub is dedicated to help current leaders to better understand the arising dilemmas on technology and global affairs, and provide an additional platform to the Master in Technology and Global Affairs in training future leaders. It operates with a focus on interdisciplinary collaboration ...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Annual Benefit Gala in New York, honoring Slawomir Krupa, CEO of Societe Generale
content: On Tuesday March 5th, the Sciences Po American Foundation celebrated its 15th anniversary year with the 2024 Annual Benefit Dinner. We honored Slawomir Krupa, CEO of Societe Generale, with the Stanley Hoffmann Award. With over two decades of experience internationally in the finance sector, and as a proud Sciences Po alum (class of ‘96), he is a perfect realization of Sciences Po’s mission to educate future international leaders. Mr. Krupa was interviewed by special guest Vladimir Duthiers, Peab...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Education Above all Fondation renews its partnership
content: On 28 February 2024, Sciences Po and the Education Above All Foundation renewed their partnership, sharing the same goal of offering quality education to young people despite challenging contexts. In 2018 Sciences Po created an ambitious and innovative program dedicated to young refugees, which is designed to meet the specific needs of people whose education has been abruptly interrupted. This  Professional Certificate for Young Refugees offers a two-year full-time program combining acquisi...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Students of the Certificate for young refugees at the Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe
content: Students of the Professional Certificate for young refugees at the Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe   On October 1st, the students of the  The Professional Certificate for young refugees had the honor of attending the prestigious Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe, invited by Education Above All Foundation, one of the program’s main partners.         “ I want to work in an international organization. This program is one of the things that can open the way for me to...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Nature in the City
content: The post-doctoral researcher Francesca Ferlicca has recently joined Sciences Po to conduct research on the project "Nature in the City," funded by the Gerard B. Lambert Foundation. In this role, she will investigate the interconnectedness of urban planning with nature, biodiversity, urban green spaces, and communal living. As an integral part of the intellectual and academic community at  Sciences Po Urban School , her activities will encompass both research and teaching, focusing on key is...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Attractive Profiles : Sciences Po students gaining appeal with employers
content: In September, Sciences Po released the results of its annual survey on the professional integration of its graduates. The survey reveals a strengthening of the attractiveness of Sciences Po profiles. Concurrently, the “Forum Carrieres” was held, which is an essential  event for students and recent graduates looking for internships, apprenticeships, or employment. The Forum Carrieres The “Forum Carrieres” provides a unique opportunity for students to meet with a lot of professionals from var...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Sciences Po gala in London
content: After a 3-year break due to the Covid crisis, the donors' gala took place on Thursday, October 19th at the Hyatt Churchill, bringing together donors and partners who came to support the new projects of our institution. Under the patronage of the French Embassy in the United Kingdom, the event brought together nearly 140 alumni and representatives from French and British companies, around Madame Hélène Tréheux-Duchêne, the French Ambassador to the United Kingdom and a former student (class of 198...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Women in the gulf leading the change
content: On Thursday May 11, the Menton campus of Sciences Po organized a meeting with Raha Moharrak, the first Saudi woman to summit Everest and the seven highest mountains on each continent. The story of Raha is an inspiring illustration of perseverance and courage for our students, demonstrating that no matter who we are or where we come from, anyone can attempt the impossible and potentially achieve it. This event is part of a series of conferences called “Women in the gulf leading the change”, which...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Focus on climate : launch of the Bruno Latour fund
content: In honour of Bruno Latour  and his legacy, his close ones but also partners, researchers and directors of Sciences Po were gathered on 16 December 2022 to launch the Bruno Latour Fund, dedicated to research in environment and politics. A priority for the institution, the creation of the Bruno Latour Fund is a sign of the rise of research at Sciences Po on environmental transformation topics, complementary of the steps already taken on climate issues (the interdisciplinary workshop on enviro...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Sciences Po 150th anniversary in London
content: On October 26 2022, Sciences Po Alumni and the French Embassy of the United Kingdom celebrated Sciences Po’s 150th anniversary at the French Residence, with Arancha Gonzalez, Dean of Sciences Po’s Paris School of International Affairs PSIA . It was the occasion to promote global scientific cooperation and the role of students and alumni to build bridges among different countries around the world. As Arancha Gonzalez reminded “Alumni are one of our biggest assets because they are around the world...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Education Above All supports Sciences Po
content: Sciences Po has made supporting refugee students a priority since the 2015 European migration crisis. In 2018, Sciences reinforced its commitment by creating the Professional Certificate for Young Refugees, a unique and ambitious programme that aims to meet the specific needs of young people whose life and studies have been interrupted and provide them with the tools to pursue their studies or careers in France. This two-year programme, certified by the French Ministry of Higher Education, helps...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Support Ukraine
content: Sciences Po stepped up its efforts as soon as the conflict in Ukraine broke out to welcome students fleeing the country and offer unique options so that students may continue their study as normally as possible. The generous support of our partners and donors made it possible to raise 570,000 euros in three months. Thanks to them, we were able to welcome 24 students from our historic partner NaUKMA and 6 students from Tarras Shevchenko University. Most of them have benefited from the annual exch...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Luksic Scholarships at Sciences Po
content: Two new scholarships for chilean students A new agreement has been reached with Sciences Po for the support of two scholarships for Chilean students admitted to a Master’s program at the university, as well as the participation of five Chilean faculty in the Teaching and Learning Workshop hosted by Sciences Po’s Institute for Skills and Innovation taking place this year.  Building on the legacy of the Sciences Po – Quiñenco Scholarships that were awarded in 2020 and 2021, it was decided tha...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Microsoft, PSIA and cyberdiplomacy
content: On the 10th of november, Sciences Po’s Paris School of International Affairs welcomed Brad Smith, director of Microsoft, for an exceptional conference on cyberdiplomacy. The students gathered in the Boutmy amphitheater had the opportunity to discuss cyber security and numeric sovereignty issues our globalized world is now facing with this leading figure in the Tech industry.  The evening was marked by Brad Smith’s call for international cooperation between governments and businesses, which ...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: An exceptional gift from Frank McCourt
content: The continuous and accelerated spread of technological innovations calls for an increase in academic research, particularly in the human and social sciences, in order to better understand, anticipate and act upon their impact on contemporary societies. To foster the commitment of its scientific community to studying, deciphering and clarifying of the major issues at stake for the common good around new technologies, including the Internet and social networks, Sciences Po announces the signing of...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: Launch of the Chair for Sustainable Development
content: On 25 November 2020, Sciences Po launched its European Chair for Sustainable Development and Climate Transition . The inaugural conference gathered experts from around the world and key environmental policy-makers.  Watch the inaugural conference : panel 1 (Europe’s Role in the World to Advance Climate Neutrality)  –  panel 2 (Territorial Inclusion for a Stronger Resilient Europe) This new transdisciplinary Chair, built in alignment with the European Green Deal which prioritizes s...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: The Chair in Sovereign Debt launches a blog
content: A year ago, the Chair in Sovereign Debt was inaugurated in the presence of former Prime Minister of Greece Aléxis Tsípras and Anne-Laure Kiechel, founder of Global Sovereign Advisory, Chair’s exclusive sponsor. Since then, students from Paris School of International Affairs (PSIA) and other Sciences Po Schools have been given the opportunity to work on case studies related to landmark debt crises and restructurings, learning from world-renowned experts on the subject. The Chair just launched a b...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub

title: More than one hundred seats already reserved in Boutmy!More than one hundred seats already reserved in Boutmy!
content: On the eve of Sciences Po’s 150th anniversary, our Paris campus is undergoing a profound transformation, designed to provide the next generations of students with learning and research conditions worthy of the greatest international universities. The forthcoming opening of the new site at 1, Saint-Thomas will further anchor Sciences Po in the heart of Paris. This is the first stage of a comprehensive renovation and remodelling project of our Paris campus.  In order to help finance this flag...
sourceTitle: Sciences Po Technology and global affairs innovation hub
